refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The p:xsl-formatter step receives an document and renders the content. The result of rendering is stored to the URI provided via the href option. A reference to that result is produced on the output port.

By default, the p:xsl-formatter step produces PDF. The content-type of the output can be controlled by the content-type option. This option specifies a media type as defined by . The option may include media type parameters as well (e.g. "application/someformat; charset=UTF-8"). The use of media type parameters on the content-type option is implementation-defined.
A formatter may take any number of optional rendering parameters via the stepâ€™s parameters; such parameters are defined by the XSL implementation used and are implementation-defined.
The output of this step is a document containing a single c:result element whose content is the absolute URI of the document stored by the step.
